intro: Lachnostoma pastasanum, commonly known as the sand lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is a symbiotic organism composed of a fungal partner and a photosynthetic alga or cyanobacterium. This lichen typically grows on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments. Its thallus is crust-like and usually has a pale to yellowish color. It plays a role in soil formation and serves as an indicator of environmental conditions.
